content:
TITLE: Create NestJS Module with Metadata (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to scaffold a NestJS module with best practices using the `create_nestjs_module` function. It supports modular structure, consistent provider patterns, and automatic metadata documentation.  It requires the `nestjs-best-practices` package and utilizes environment variables such as CONFLUENCE_API_TOKEN.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adird/nestjs-best-practices/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { create_nestjs_module } from 'nestjs-best-practices';

const UserModule = create_nestjs_module({
  api_key: process.env.CONFLUENCE_API_TOKEN,
  name: 'UserModule',
  imports: [],
  controllers: [UserController],
  providers: [UserService],
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Create NestJS Package with Metadata (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to scaffold a reusable NestJS package using the `create_nestjs_package` function.  It adds documentation, tests, and configuration files. It requires the `nestjs-best-practices` package and uses environment variables such as CONFLUENCE_API_TOKEN.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adird/nestjs-best-practices/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { create_nestjs_package } from 'nestjs-best-practices';

create_nestjs_package({
  api_key: process.env.CONFLUENCE_API_TOKEN,
  packageName: 'nestjs-feature-toggle',
  description: 'Feature toggle module with async guards',
  author: 'team-platform',
  internal: true,
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Create NestJS Logger with Metadata (TypeScript)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to create a pre-configured NestJS logger using the `create_nestjs_logger` function. It utilizes `@nestjs/common`'s `LoggerService` for consistent, contextual, and structured logging. It requires the `nestjs-best-practices` package and environment variables such as CONFLUENCE_API_TOKEN.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adird/nestjs-best-practices/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { create_nestjs_logger } from 'nestjs-best-practices';

const logger = create_nestjs_logger({
  api_key: process.env.CONFLUENCE_API_TOKEN,
  serviceName: 'user-service',
  environment: 'production',
  context: 'UserController',
});

logger.log('Logger initialized successfully');
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Confluence Docs POST Request
DESCRIPTION: This snippet represents a POST request sent to update internal documentation in Confluence. The actual data sent in the request depends on the context where it's used, typically containing metadata about a logger, module, or package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adird/nestjs-best-practices/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
POST my.external.confluence.docs(token)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Run tests
DESCRIPTION: This command executes the test suite for the project. It assumes that the project has been set up with a testing framework and the `test` script is configured in the `package.json` file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adird/nestjs-best-practices/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install nestjs-best-practices using yarn
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the nestjs-best-practices package using yarn, providing access to its utility functions within your NestJS project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adird/nestjs-best-practices/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn add nestjs-best-practices
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install nestjs-best-practices using npm
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the nestjs-best-practices package using npm, allowing you to use its utility functions in your NestJS project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/adird/nestjs-best-practices/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install nestjs-best-practices
```
